question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/response.rs] [Struct: LedgerInfo header propagation] [Time-of-check-time-of-use] Can there be race conditions between when LedgerInfo is captured and when headers are set, allowing responses to reflect stale blockchain state during rapid block production? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/webserver.rs] [Function: serve() bind] [Port binding race] Can multiple nodes attempt to bind the same port simultaneously, and does the error handling properly distinguish between port conflicts and other binding failures to prevent silent failures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/error.rs] [Function: bad_request()] [Attack amplification] Can attackers trigger bad_request errors with extremely long Display messages that cause excessive logging, memory allocation, or network bandwidth consumption in error responses? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/response.rs] [Header: X_APTOS_CHAIN_ID] [Chain confusion] Can chain_id being cast to u16 limit support to only 65,536 chains, and could this create ambiguity if two legitimate chains have the same chain_id modulo 65,536? (Medium)
